text: One reason "Scripting News" will never be HTTPS, one that I hadn't thought of until today, it would mean I couldn't link to pages that weren't HTTPS. That would mean walking away from all of my web writing, going back to 1994. And everything other people wrote that I pointed to. You may not care about continuity, but I've seen vast amounts of knowledge lost because of similar kinds of thinking. The tradeoff just isn't worth it.
